form.longName: PhenX PX010502 - Ethnicity
form.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the respondent if he or she considers himself or herself to be Hispanic, Latino or Spanish and, if so, asks an additional question about his or her specific Hispanic origin is asked. One or more Hispanic origin categories may be selected.

question.questionText: Do you consider yourself to be Hispanic, Latino, or of Spanish origin? (ethnicity_self_identification)
READ IF NECESSARY: Where do your ancestors come from? (ethnicity_self_identification_ancestry)

HELP SCREEN:SPANISH, HISPANIC OR LATINO PEOPLE MAY BE OF ANY RACE. LISTED BELOW ARE HISPANIC OR LATINO CATEGORIES/COUNTRIES: .MEXICAN…PUERTO RICAN…CUBAN…DOMINICAN REPUBLICCENTRAL AMERICAN: COSTA RICAN GUATEMALAN HONDURAN NICARAGUAN PANAMANIAN SALVADORAN OTHER CENTRAL AMERICANSOUTH AMERICAN: ARGENTINIAN BOLIVIAN CHILEAN COLUMBIAN ECUADORIAN PARAGUAYAN PERUVIAN URUGUAYAN VENEZUELAN OTHER SOUTH AMERICANOTHER HISPANIC OR LATINO:SPANIARD…SPANISH…SPANISH AMERICAN (ethnicity_ancestry_description)
Where do your ancestors come from? (ethnicity_ancestry)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the respondent if he or she considers himself or herself to be Hispanic, Latino or Spanish and, if so, asks an additional question about his or her specific Hispanic origin is asked. One or more Hispanic origin categories may be selected.

form.longName: PhenX PX010602 - Race
form.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the respondent what race he or she considers himself or herself to be and hands the respondent a card with a list of race categories. The respondent is asked to pick one or more of the categories on the card. The interviewer enters the code for the race indicated or keys in an entry if the respondent chooses an "other (specify)" option.

question.questionText: What race or races do you consider yourself to be? Please select one or more. (race_self_identification)

validValue.meaningText: NATIVE HAWAIIAN OR PACIFIC ISLANDER [GO TO Q3]
validValue.description: NATIVE HAWAIIAN OR PACIFIC ISLANDER [GO TO Q3]

question.questionText: Where do your ancestors come from? (race_self_identification_asian)
Where do your ancestors come from? (race_self_identification_pacificislander)
CODE ANSWER TO "OTHER RACE" (race_self_identification_otherrace)
OTHER HISPANIC/LATINO (SPECIFY) (race_self_identification_otherlatino)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the respondent what race he or she considers himself or herself to be and hands the respondent a card with a list of race categories. The respondent is asked to pick one or more of the categories on the card. The interviewer enters the code for the race indicated or keys in an entry if the respondent chooses an "other (specify)" option.

form.longName: PhenX PX010902 - Current Marital Status
form.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the respondent about his or her current marital status by presenting a numbered card that lists answer choices. The respondent may select one category.

question.questionText: Now I'd like to ask about marital status and living together. Please look at Card 1. What is your current marital or cohabiting status? (current_martial_status_opposite_sex)

validValue.meaningText: Married to a person of the opposite sex
validValue.description: Married to a person of the opposite sex

validValue.meaningText: Not married but living together with a partner of the opposite sex
validValue.description: Not married but living together with a partner of the opposite sex

validValue.meaningText: Separated, because you and your spouse are not getting along
validValue.description: Separated, because you and your spouse are not getting along

question.questionText: [Complete if respondent volunteered information indicating living in a same-sex marriage or with a same-sex partner] Now I'd like to ask about marital status and living together. Please look at Card 1. What is your current marital or cohabiting status? (current_martial_status_same_sex)

validValue.meaningText: Married to a person of the same sex
validValue.description: Married to a person of the same sex

validValue.meaningText: Not married but living together with a partner of the same sex
validValue.description: Not married but living together with a partner of the same sex

validValue.meaningText: Separated, because you and your spouse are not getting along
validValue.description: Separated, because you and your spouse are not getting along

question.questionText: What is your formal marital status? That is, are you widowed, divorced, separated, or have you never been married? (current_martial_status_not_married)

validValue.meaningText: Separated, because you and your spouse are not getting along
validValue.description: Separated, because you and your spouse are not getting along

protocol.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the respondent about his or her current marital status by presenting a numbered card that lists answer choices. The respondent may select one category.

form.longName: PhenX PX030202 - Alcohol Age Of First Use
form.preferredDefinition: Measurement to ascertain the respondent's age at which he or she had his or her first alcoholic drink.

question.questionText: Think about the first time you had a drink of an alcoholic beverage. How old were you the first time you had a drink of an alcoholic beverage? Please do not include any time when you only had a sip or two from a drink. (alcohol_first_use_age)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Measurement to ascertain the respondent's age at which he or she had his or her first alcoholic drink.

form.longName: PhenX PX030402 - Alcohol Maximum Drinks In 24 Hours
form.preferredDefinition: Lifetime measurement of the largest number of drinks a respondent has consumed taken from the National Epidemiologic Survey on Alcohol and Related Conditions-III (NESARC-III).

question.questionText: APPROXIMATELY what was the largest number of drinks that you drank in a single day? (alcohol_maximum_drinks_hours24_number)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Lifetime measurement of the largest number of drinks a respondent has consumed taken from the National Epidemiologic Survey on Alcohol and Related Conditions-III (NESARC-III).

form.longName: PhenX PX030703 - Age Of Initiation Of First Cigarette Use Adult
form.preferredDefinition: Measurement to ascertain the respondent's age of initiation of first/regular use of cigarettes, which can be used to calculate duration of use and pack-years measures. The PhenX Working Group modified the Adult Protocol to provide a more precise measure. The original wording of "fairly regularly" was changed to "every day."

module.longName: Age Of Initiation Of First Cigarette Use Adult
module.preferredDefinition: Age Of Initiation Of First Cigarette Use Adult

question.questionText: Have you smoked at least 100 cigarettes if your entire life? (age_firstcigarette_adult_hundred)
How old were you when you first started smoking cigarettes FAIRLY REGULARLY? (age_firstcigarette_adult_smokeregularly)
How old were you when you first started smoking cigarettes FAIRLY REGULARLY? (age_firstcigarette_adult_smokeregularly_coded)
You said that you never smoked regularly. How old were you the first time you smoked part or all of a cigarette? (age_firstcigarette_adult_first_time)

protocol.longName: Age of Initiation of First Cigarette Use - Adult
protocol.preferredDefinition: Measurement to ascertain the respondent's age of initiation of first/regular use of cigarettes, which can be used to calculate duration of use and pack-years measures. The PhenX Working Group modified the Adult Protocol to provide a more precise measure. The original wording of "fairly regularly" was changed to "every day."

form.preferredDefinition: Measurement to ascertain when the respondent quit smoking. Response is used to calculate duration of use and pack-years measures and allows one to distinguish recent quitters from long-time quitters.

validValue.meaningText: More than 12 months ago but within the past 3 years
validValue.description: More than 12 months ago but within the past 3 years

Earlier the computer recorded that you last smoked part or all of a cigarette [input response to Question 1]. How old were you the last time you smoked part or all of a cigarette? (smoking_cessation_age_coded)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Measurement to ascertain when the respondent quit smoking. Response is used to calculate duration of use and pack-years measures and allows one to distinguish recent quitters from long-time quitters.

form.longName: PhenX PX031202 - Substances Age Of First Use
form.preferredDefinition: Measurement to ascertain the respondent's age of initiation of first use of substances.

question.questionText: How old were you the first time you used? (first_use_age_substances)
How old were you the first time you used? (first_use_age_substances_encoded)

form.longName: PhenX PX031302 - Substances 30day Frequency
form.preferredDefinition: Measurement of respondent's 30-day frequency of use of drugs.

question.questionText: Think specifically about the past 30 days, from [DATEFILL**] up to and including today. During the past 30 days, on how many days did you use? (frequency_substances)

form.longName: PhenX PX091102 - Pulse Oximetry Rest
form.preferredDefinition: A trained technician places a sensor on a thin part of the patient's body, usually a fingertip or earlobe, to monitor the oxygenation of the patient's hemoglobin.

question.questionText: What is the oxygen saturation of haemoglobin in the arterial blood (SpO2)? (pulse_oximetry_rest_oxygen_saturation)
What is the pulse rate, averaged over 5 to 20 seconds? (pulse_oximetry_rest_pulse_rate)
Is the oxygen saturation at 95% or more? (pulse_oximetry_rest_oxygen_saturation_healthy)

protocol.preferredDefinition: A trained technician places a sensor on a thin part of the patient's body, usually a fingertip or earlobe, to monitor the oxygenation of the patient's hemoglobin.

Which of the services (did/have) you or your/partner*) (have/had) to help you have a baby together? ENTER all that apply: (causes_treatments_infertility_male_consultation_options)

When you and your partner* went for medical help to have a baby together, were you ever told that you had any of the following male infertility problems? ENTER all that apply: (causes_treatments_infertility_male_problems)

validValue.meaningText: Low sperm count or no semen
validValue.description: Low sperm count or no semen

validValue.meaningText: Genetic disorder that alters sperm production
validValue.description: Genetic disorder that alters sperm production

form.longName: PhenX PX100304 - Current Contraception Use Male
form.preferredDefinition: Male participants are asked about contraception use in the last 12 months.

question.questionText: Including any methods you may have already told me about and methods you may have used only once, during the last 12 months, which of these methods did you and she use to prevent pregnancy or sexually transmitted diseases? (current_contraception_use_male_last_year)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Male participants are asked about contraception use in the last 12 months.

form.longName: PhenX PX100404 - Difficulty Getting Pregnant Retrospective Assessment
form.preferredDefinition: Depending on the aims of the project and feasibility, there are three widely used methods to assess difficulty getting pregnant or impaired fecundity. These include: retrospective assessment, prospective assessment, and the current duration approach. For the retrospective approach (also the approach used for cross-sectional studies), women or couples are asked if the pregnancy was planned and, if yes, how many months it took to get pregnant. It is important to note that this approach can only be used with women or couples who planned their pregnancies. For prospective assessment, women or couples are followed over time as they try to get pregnant. Women or couples are asked to record exposure data, menstrual cycle data, intercourse, and pregnancy status prospectively over time. Again, this method can only be employed with women or couples who are planning a pregnancy. If investigators are interested in exposures among women or couples who are not planning a pregnancy, the current duration approach can be used. For this approach, women or couples are asked about the date that they last used contraception.

question.questionText: Was this pregnancy planned? (difficulty_getting_pregnant_retrospective_planned)
How many months did it take you to get pregnant? (difficulty_getting_pregnant_retrospective_month)
Has there ever been a time in your life during which you didn't become pregnant despite 12 or more months of regular unprotected intercourse? (difficulty_getting_pregnant_retrospective_not_pregnant)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Depending on the aims of the project and feasibility, there are three widely used methods to assess difficulty getting pregnant or impaired fecundity. These include: retrospective assessment, prospective assessment, and the current duration approach. For the retrospective approach (also the approach used for cross-sectional studies), women or couples are asked if the pregnancy was planned and, if yes, how many months it took to get pregnant. It is important to note that this approach can only be used with women or couples who planned their pregnancies. For prospective assessment, women or couples are followed over time as they try to get pregnant. Women or couples are asked to record exposure data, menstrual cycle data, intercourse, and pregnancy status prospectively over time. Again, this method can only be employed with women or couples who are planning a pregnancy. If investigators are interested in exposures among women or couples who are not planning a pregnancy, the current duration approach can be used. For this approach, women or couples are asked about the date that they last used contraception.

form.longName: PhenX PX100502 - Removal Of Female Reproductive Organs
form.preferredDefinition: The participant answers a question about whether she has had a hysterectomy. If so, she answers a question about whether she has also had any ovaries removed.

question.questionText: Have you ever had a hysterectomy, that is, surgery to remove your uterus? (removal_female_reproductive_organs_hysterectomy_uterus)
Have you ever had both of your ovaries removed? (removal_female_reproductive_organs_ovaries)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The participant answers a question about whether she has had a hysterectomy. If so, she answers a question about whether she has also had any ovaries removed.

form.longName: PhenX PX100802 - Human Papillomavirus Vaccine Use
form.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the individual whether s/he ever received a human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccination. If the response is yes, the interviewer asks about number of shots received.

question.questionText: A vaccine to prevent the human papillomavirus or HPV infection is available and is called the cervical cancer or genital warts vaccine, HPV shot [Fill: if female “GARDASIL or CERVARIX”; if male “ or GARDASIL”]. Have you EVER had an HPV vaccination? (human_papillomavirus_vaccine_hpv_vaccination_ever)

validValue.meaningText: Doctor refused when asked (skip to end)
validValue.description: Doctor refused when asked (skip to end)

question.questionText: How many HPV shots did you receive? (human_papillomavirus_vaccine_hpv_vaccination_number)
How many HPV shots did you receive? (human_papillomavirus_vaccine_hpv_vaccination_number_encoded)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the individual whether s/he ever received a human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccination. If the response is yes, the interviewer asks about number of shots received.

form.longName: PhenX PX130703 - Global Mental Status Screener Older Children And Adole
form.preferredDefinition: The Children's Global Assessment Scale (CGAS) is an interviewer-administered instrument that uses all available information to assess the overall functioning of a child. The CGAS reflects the lowest level of functioning during a specified time period. The CGAS is separated into ten 10-point sections headed with a description of function (e.g., Doing Very Well, Doing Well). The scores ranges from 1 (most impaired) to 100 (healthiest), with scores of 70 or above indicating normal function.

module.longName: Global Mental Status Screener Older Children And Adole
module.preferredDefinition: Global Mental Status Screener Older Children And Adole

question.questionText: What Children's rating would best describe the young person's functioning? (global_mental_status_screener_older_children_adolescents_rating_functioning)

validValue.meaningText: SOME PROBLEMS - in one area only
validValue.description: SOME PROBLEMS - in one area only

validValue.meaningText: SOME NOTICEABLE PROBLEMS - in more than one area
validValue.description: SOME NOTICEABLE PROBLEMS - in more than one area

validValue.meaningText: OBVIOUS PROBLEMS - moderate impairment in most areas or severe in one area
validValue.description: OBVIOUS PROBLEMS - moderate impairment in most areas or severe in one area

validValue.meaningText: SERIOUS PROBLEMS - major impairment in several areas and unable to function in one area
validValue.description: SERIOUS PROBLEMS - major impairment in several areas and unable to function in one area

validValue.meaningText: SEVERE PROBLEMS - unable to function in almost all situations
validValue.description: SEVERE PROBLEMS - unable to function in almost all situations

validValue.meaningText: VERY SEVERELY IMPAIRED - considerable supervision is required for safety
validValue.description: VERY SEVERELY IMPAIRED - considerable supervision is required for safety

validValue.meaningText: EXTREMELY IMPAIRED - constant supervision is required for safety
validValue.description: EXTREMELY IMPAIRED - constant supervision is required for safety

question.questionText: At what date was the Children's Global Assessment Scale rating assigned? (global_mental_status_screener_older_children_adolescents_rating_functioning_date)

protocol.longName: Global Mental Status Screener - Older Children and Adolescents
protocol.preferredDefinition: The Children's Global Assessment Scale (CGAS) is an interviewer-administered instrument that uses all available information to assess the overall functioning of a child. The CGAS reflects the lowest level of functioning during a specified time period. The CGAS is separated into ten 10-point sections headed with a description of function (e.g., Doing Very Well, Doing Well). The scores ranges from 1 (most impaired) to 100 (healthiest), with scores of 70 or above indicating normal function.

form.longName: PhenX PX131801 - Spatial Reasoning Adolescents And Adults
form.preferredDefinition: The Block Design Test is an interviewer-administered test that is part of the Wechsler Adult Intelligence ScaleTM, Fourth Edition (WAISTM-IV). The participants are given a picture and asked to use red and white blocks to recreate the design.

question.questionText: Did the participants recreate the design? (spatial_reasoning_adolescents_adults_recreate_design)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The Block Design Test is an interviewer-administered test that is part of the Wechsler Adult Intelligence ScaleTM, Fourth Edition (WAISTM-IV). The participants are given a picture and asked to use red and white blocks to recreate the design.

form.longName: PhenX PX131901 - Parkinsons Disease Screener Questionnaire
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes one question from the Framingham Heart Study that assess whether the participant has ever been told by a doctor that her or she has Parkinson's disease.

question.questionText: Have you been told by a doctor you have Parkinson's Disease? (parkinsons_disease_screener_questionnaire)

protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes one question from the Framingham Heart Study that assess whether the participant has ever been told by a doctor that her or she has Parkinson's disease.

form.longName: PhenX PX240101 - Adequacy Of Prenatal Care
form.preferredDefinition: The Dietary Screener Questionnaire (DSQ) is a 30-item questionnaire from the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES) 2009-2010 series. The interview includes items about frequency of intake of various food items (per month, daily, etc.).

question.questionText: Month of initiation of care (adequacy_prenatal_care_initiation)
Percent of recommended visits received (adequacy_prenatal_care_percentage)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The Dietary Screener Questionnaire (DSQ) is a 30-item questionnaire from the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES) 2009-2010 series. The interview includes items about frequency of intake of various food items (per month, daily, etc.).

form.longName: PhenX PX240602 - Current Pregnancy Status Selfreport
form.preferredDefinition: A single interviewer-administered item.

question.questionText: {Are you or Is SP} pregnant now? (pregnancy_current_status)

protocol.preferredDefinition: A single interviewer-administered item.

form.longName: PhenX PX250701 - Cystatin C Assay For Kidney Function
form.preferredDefinition: Determination of fetal growth is a three-step process: Step 1: Ascertainment of estimated fetal weight (EFW) Step 2: Verification of gestational age (GA) at which the EFW was recorded Step 3: Determination of EFW or biometry percentiles by plotting the EFW or relevant biometric measures at the appropriate GA on a pre-defined fetal growth curve

module.longName: Cystatin C Assay For Kidney Function
module.preferredDefinition: Cystatin C Assay For Kidney Function

question.questionText: Do you have hemophilia? (Cystatin_C_Assay_Kidney_Function_Hemophilia)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Determination of fetal growth is a three-step process: Step 1: Ascertainment of estimated fetal weight (EFW) Step 2: Verification of gestational age (GA) at which the EFW was recorded Step 3: Determination of EFW or biometry percentiles by plotting the EFW or relevant biometric measures at the appropriate GA on a pre-defined fetal growth curve

Is the pain aching or stiffness mild, moderate, or severe in your [Right/left] foot? (probe: if you had to choose one word, which one would it be?) 3a) Right foot (Pain_Degree_Right)
Is the pain aching or stiffness mild, moderate, or severe in your [Right/left] foot? (probe: if you had to choose one word, which one would it be?) 3b) Left foot (Pain_Degree_Left)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Determination of fetal growth is a three-step process: Step 1: Ascertainment of estimated fetal weight (EFW) Step 2: Verification of gestational age (GA) at which the EFW was recorded Step 3: Determination of EFW or biometry percentiles by plotting the EFW or relevant biometric measures at the appropriate GA on a pre-defined fetal growth curve

form.longName: PhenX PX251001 - Frailty
form.preferredDefinition: Determination of fetal growth is a three-step process: Step 1: Ascertainment of estimated fetal weight (EFW) Step 2: Verification of gestational age (GA) at which the EFW was recorded Step 3: Determination of EFW or biometry percentiles by plotting the EFW or relevant biometric measures at the appropriate GA on a pre-defined fetal growth curve

question.questionText: What was your weight 3 years ago? __ __ __ lbs (Frailty_Weight_Three_Years_Ago)
What is your weight today? __ __ __ lbs (Frailty_Weight_Today)
[Interviewer/computer: calculate weight loss percentage] Change in weight (Q1-Q2)/weight 3 years ago (Q1) ___ __ % loss (Frailty_Weight_Loss_Percentage)
[Interviewer: Ask respondent to sit in chair, then rise up without using arms, repeat 4 more times.] Was respondent able to do chair stands without assistance? (Frailty_Ability_Chair_Stands)
Do you feel full of energy? (Frailty_Energy_Level)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Determination of fetal growth is a three-step process: Step 1: Ascertainment of estimated fetal weight (EFW) Step 2: Verification of gestational age (GA) at which the EFW was recorded Step 3: Determination of EFW or biometry percentiles by plotting the EFW or relevant biometric measures at the appropriate GA on a pre-defined fetal growth curve

form.longName: PhenX PX251601 - Urinary Incontinence
form.preferredDefinition: Determination of fetal growth is a three-step process: Step 1: Ascertainment of estimated fetal weight (EFW) Step 2: Verification of gestational age (GA) at which the EFW was recorded Step 3: Determination of EFW or biometry percentiles by plotting the EFW or relevant biometric measures at the appropriate GA on a pre-defined fetal growth curve

question.questionText: In the past 12 months, how often have you leaked urine? (Urinary_Incontinence_Leaked_Urine)

validValue.meaningText: one or more times per month
validValue.description: one or more times per month

validValue.meaningText: one or more times per week
validValue.description: one or more times per week

question.questionText: In the past 12 months, when does your leakage usually occur? (Urinary_Incontinence_Leakage_Usually_Occur)

validValue.meaningText: With an activity like coughing, lifting, standing up or exercise
validValue.description: With an activity like coughing, lifting, standing up or exercise

validValue.meaningText: When you have the urge to urinate and can't get to a toilet fast enough
validValue.description: When you have the urge to urinate and can't get to a toilet fast enough

validValue.meaningText: You leak urine unrelated to coughing, sneezing, lifting or urge
validValue.description: You leak urine unrelated to coughing, sneezing, lifting or urge

question.questionText: Do you wear any protection for when you leak urine? (Urinary_Incontinence_Wear_Protection)
During a typical day, how many times, on average, do you change your protection because it is wet? (Urinary_Incontinence_Change_Protection)

How much does the leakage of urine interfere with your daily activities (such as work, exercise, shopping, or recreational activities)? Would you say (Urinary_Incontinence_Leakage_Interfere_Daily_Activities)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Determination of fetal growth is a three-step process: Step 1: Ascertainment of estimated fetal weight (EFW) Step 2: Verification of gestational age (GA) at which the EFW was recorded Step 3: Determination of EFW or biometry percentiles by plotting the EFW or relevant biometric measures at the appropriate GA on a pre-defined fetal growth curve

form.longName: PhenX PX510304 - Patterns Of Substance Use Adults Bingedrinking
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes questions from the National Epidemiologic Survey on Alcohol and Related Conditions-III (NESARC-III), Alcohol Use Disorder and Associated Disabilities Interview Schedule-5 (AUDADIS-5). These specific questions are used to determine whether a respondent in the past 12 months has participated in binge drinking and the frequency.

protocol.longName: Patterns of Substance Use - Adults - Binge-Drinking
protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes questions from the National Epidemiologic Survey on Alcohol and Related Conditions-III (NESARC-III), Alcohol Use Disorder and Associated Disabilities Interview Schedule-5 (AUDADIS-5). These specific questions are used to determine whether a respondent in the past 12 months has participated in binge drinking and the frequency.

form.longName: PhenX PX520307 - Selfreported Craving General
form.preferredDefinition: The respondent is asked questions from the National Epidemiologic Survey on Alcohol and Related Conditions-III (NESARC-III) about his or her craving to drink alcohol, use tobacco or nicotine, or use drugs in the past 12 months.

question.questionText: In the last 12 months, did you want a drink so badly that you couldnit think of anything else? (self_reported_craving__general_drink)
In the last 12 months, did you want to use tobacco or nicotine so badly that you couldnit think of anything else? (self_reported_craving__general_tobacco_)
In the last 12 months, did you want a medicine or drug so badly that you couldnit think of anything else? (self_reported_craving__general_medicine)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The respondent is asked questions from the National Epidemiologic Survey on Alcohol and Related Conditions-III (NESARC-III) about his or her craving to drink alcohol, use tobacco or nicotine, or use drugs in the past 12 months.

form.longName: PhenX PX520506 - Motives Alcohol Tobacco And Other Substances Specifi

protocol.longName: Motives - Alcohol, Tobacco and Other Substances - Specific - Drugs
protocol.preferredDefinition: Respondents complete self-administered questions from the Monitoring the Future (MTF) 2015 questionnaire regarding their reason(s) for using marijuana or hasish, amphetamines or other stimulant drugs, tranquilizers, cocaine and/or narcotics other than heroin (e.g., feel good, fit in, anger, tastes good, hooked)

form.longName: PhenX PX530402 - Inhibitory Control Stop Signal Paradigm
form.preferredDefinition: STOP-IT is a computer-administered stop-signal task. Participants react as quickly as possible to a visual stimulus unless it is followed by an auditory stop signal presented after a variable delay. STOP-IT includes an analysis module (ANALYZE-IT) that calculates several summary variables. For more conceptual information about the stop-signal task, please refer to the entry for the Stop-signal task in the Cognitive Atlas: [link[cognitiveatlas.org/term/stop_signal_task|http://www.cognitiveatlas.org/term/stop_signal_task]]

question.questionText: What is the calculated estimation of stop signal reaction time? Longer stop signal reaction time indicates greater motor impulsivity. (inhibitory_control)

protocol.preferredDefinition: STOP-IT is a computer-administered stop-signal task. Participants react as quickly as possible to a visual stimulus unless it is followed by an auditory stop signal presented after a variable delay. STOP-IT includes an analysis module (ANALYZE-IT) that calculates several summary variables. For more conceptual information about the stop-signal task, please refer to the entry for the Stop-signal task in the Cognitive Atlas: [link[cognitiveatlas.org/term/stop_signal_task|http://www.cognitiveatlas.org/term/stop_signal_task]]

form.longName: PhenX PX560303 - Duration Of Abstinence Alcohol
form.preferredDefinition: Respondents answer questions from the National Epidemiologic Survey on Alcohol and Related Conditions-III (NESARC-III) related to recent alcohol consumption.

question.questionText: How long has it been since you last had a drink of any kind of alcohol? Days (duration_abstinence_alcohol_days)
How long has it been since you last had a drink of any kind of alcohol? Weeks (duration_abstinence_alcohol_weeks)
How long has it been since you last had a drink of any kind of alcohol? Months (duration_abstinence_alcohol_months)
How long has it been since you last had a drink of any kind of alcohol? Years (duration_abstinence_alcohol_years)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Respondents answer questions from the National Epidemiologic Survey on Alcohol and Related Conditions-III (NESARC-III) related to recent alcohol consumption.

form.longName: PhenX PX560304 - Duration Of Abstinence Substance Use
form.preferredDefinition: Respondents answer questions from the National Epidemiologic Survey on Alcohol and Related Conditions-III (NESARC-III) related to recent prescription and illegal drug use.

question.questionText: When was the most recent time you used (Name of drug category)? Days (duration__abstinence_substance_use_days)
When was the most recent time you used (Name of drug category)? Weeks (duration__abstinence_substance_use_weeks)
When was the most recent time you used (Name of drug category)? Months (duration__abstinence_substance_use_months)
When was the most recent time you used (Name of drug category)? Years (duration__abstinence_substance_use_years)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Respondents answer questions from the National Epidemiologic Survey on Alcohol and Related Conditions-III (NESARC-III) related to recent prescription and illegal drug use.

form.longName: PhenX PX630801 - Disability Due To Mental Health Symptoms
form.preferredDefinition: The Sheehan Disability Scale (SDS) includes three self-rated items designed to measure how work, social life, and family life are impaired by current psychiatric symptoms (e.g., panic, anxiety, phobia, or depression). Each item includes an 11-point analog scale that uses visual-spatial, numeric, and verbal descriptive anchors simultaneously to represent the degree of disruption. The numerical ratings of 0-10 can be translated into a percentage or summed into a single dimensional measure of global functional impairment that ranges from 0 (unimpaired) to 30 (highly impaired). There are no formal norms or recommended cutoff scores. Two optional items quantify days lost and days underproductive at work or school.

module.longName: Disability Due To Mental Health Symptoms
module.preferredDefinition: Disability Due To Mental Health Symptoms

question.questionText: The symptoms have disrupted your social life / leisure activities: (Disability_Disrupt_Social_Life)
The symptoms have disrupted your family life / home responsibilities: (Disability_Disrupt_Family_Life)
On how many days in the last week did your symptoms cause you to miss school or work or leave you unable to carry out your normal daily responsibilities? (Disability_Days_Lost)
On how many days in the last week did you feel so impaired by your symptoms, that even though you went to school or work, your productivity was reduced? (Disability_Days_Unproductive)

protocol.longName: Disability Due to Mental Health Symptoms
protocol.preferredDefinition: The Sheehan Disability Scale (SDS) includes three self-rated items designed to measure how work, social life, and family life are impaired by current psychiatric symptoms (e.g., panic, anxiety, phobia, or depression). Each item includes an 11-point analog scale that uses visual-spatial, numeric, and verbal descriptive anchors simultaneously to represent the degree of disruption. The numerical ratings of 0-10 can be translated into a percentage or summed into a single dimensional measure of global functional impairment that ranges from 0 (unimpaired) to 30 (highly impaired). There are no formal norms or recommended cutoff scores. Two optional items quantify days lost and days underproductive at work or school.

form.longName: PhenX PX662301 - Shared Decision Making In Clinical Encounters
form.preferredDefinition: The CollaboRATE questionnaire is a 3-item, self-administered questionnaire that measures the shared decision-making process. Each item is scored on a 5-point Likert-type scale (0 = no effort was made; 4 = every effort was made). The scores of the individual items are together to give a total score, with higher scores indicating greater shared decision making.

module.longName: Shared Decision Making In Clinical Encounters
module.preferredDefinition: Shared Decision Making In Clinical Encounters

question.questionText: How much effort was made to help you understand your health issues? (shared_decision_making_understand_issues)

validValue.meaningText: A lot of effort was made
validValue.description: A lot of effort was made

question.questionText: How much effort was made to listen to the things that matter most to you about your health issues? (shared_decision_making_importance)

validValue.meaningText: A lot of effort was made
validValue.description: A lot of effort was made

question.questionText: How much effort was made to include what matters most to you in choosing what to do next? (shared_decision_making_understand_options)

validValue.meaningText: A lot of effort was made
validValue.description: A lot of effort was made

protocol.longName: Shared Decision Making in Clinical Encounters
protocol.preferredDefinition: The CollaboRATE questionnaire is a 3-item, self-administered questionnaire that measures the shared decision-making process. Each item is scored on a 5-point Likert-type scale (0 = no effort was made; 4 = every effort was made). The scores of the individual items are together to give a total score, with higher scores indicating greater shared decision making.

form.longName: PhenX PX662401 - Incarceration Adolescents
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes two self-administered questions about time spent in juvenile detention centers from the Youth Mental Health Service Utilization section of the National Survey on Drug Use and Health (NSDUH) 2014 Questionnaire.

question.questionText: These next questions are about experiences with the justice system. During the past 12 months, that is, since [DATEFILL], did you stay overnight or longer in any type of juvenile detention center, sometimes called “juvie,” prison, or jail? (incarceration_adolescent_past_year)
During the past 12 months, how many nights altogether did you stay in any type of juvenile detention center, prison, or jail? (incarceration_adolescent_past_year_total)

protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes two self-administered questions about time spent in juvenile detention centers from the Youth Mental Health Service Utilization section of the National Survey on Drug Use and Health (NSDUH) 2014 Questionnaire.

form.longName: PhenX PX662402 - Incarceration Adult
form.preferredDefinition: The Global Appraisal of Individual Needs (GAIN) Self-Help Involvement Scale (SHIS) is a self-report instrument comprised of 1 item about days attending self-help meetings in the past 90 days, 16 items with yes/no questions about behaviors associated with engaging in self-help in the past 90 days, and 1 item with a check-all-that-apply list of types of self-help meeting involvement.

question.questionText: Not counting minor traffic violations, have you ever been arrested and booked for breaking the law? (incarceration_adult_arrested)
[IF SP01 = 1] Not counting minor traffic violations, how many times during the past 12 months have you been arrested and booked for breaking a law? (incarceration_adult_arrested_past_year)
Were you on probation at any time during the past 12 months? (incarceration_adult_probation_past_year)
Were you on parole, supervised release, or other conditional release from prison at any time during the past 12 months? (incarceration_adult_parol_past_year)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The Global Appraisal of Individual Needs (GAIN) Self-Help Involvement Scale (SHIS) is a self-report instrument comprised of 1 item about days attending self-help meetings in the past 90 days, 16 items with yes/no questions about behaviors associated with engaging in self-help in the past 90 days, and 1 item with a check-all-that-apply list of types of self-help meeting involvement.

form.longName: PhenX PX662601 - Brain Connectivity And Activation
form.preferredDefinition: The Global Appraisal of Individual Needs (GAIN) Self-Help Involvement Scale (SHIS) is a self-report instrument comprised of 1 item about days attending self-help meetings in the past 90 days, 16 items with yes/no questions about behaviors associated with engaging in self-help in the past 90 days, and 1 item with a check-all-that-apply list of types of self-help meeting involvement.

question.questionText: task functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) machine Model (task_functional_magnetic_resonance_imaging_machine_model)
task functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) Image ID (task_functional_magnetic_resonance_imaging_image_id)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The Global Appraisal of Individual Needs (GAIN) Self-Help Involvement Scale (SHIS) is a self-report instrument comprised of 1 item about days attending self-help meetings in the past 90 days, 16 items with yes/no questions about behaviors associated with engaging in self-help in the past 90 days, and 1 item with a check-all-that-apply list of types of self-help meeting involvement.

form.longName: PhenX PX741201 - Tobacco Retailer Density Neighborhood
form.preferredDefinition: The Global Appraisal of Individual Needs (GAIN) Self-Help Involvement Scale (SHIS) is a self-report instrument comprised of 1 item about days attending self-help meetings in the past 90 days, 16 items with yes/no questions about behaviors associated with engaging in self-help in the past 90 days, and 1 item with a check-all-that-apply list of types of self-help meeting involvement.

question.questionText: What is the number of tobacco retailers within 500 meter and 1 kilometer service areas around each participant address? (tobacco_retailer_density_neighborhood)
What is the density? (Divide count by land area for each buffer. Land area is to be extracted from Census 2010 data) (tobacco_retailer_density_neighborhood_calculated)
Using the ArcGIS Closest Facility tool, what is the calculated roadway distance (in meters) from each participant to the nearest tobacco retailer? (tobacco_retailer_proximity_neighborhood)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The Global Appraisal of Individual Needs (GAIN) Self-Help Involvement Scale (SHIS) is a self-report instrument comprised of 1 item about days attending self-help meetings in the past 90 days, 16 items with yes/no questions about behaviors associated with engaging in self-help in the past 90 days, and 1 item with a check-all-that-apply list of types of self-help meeting involvement.

form.longName: PhenX PX741202 - Tobacco Retailer Density Residence
form.preferredDefinition: The Global Appraisal of Individual Needs (GAIN) Self-Help Involvement Scale (SHIS) is a self-report instrument comprised of 1 item about days attending self-help meetings in the past 90 days, 16 items with yes/no questions about behaviors associated with engaging in self-help in the past 90 days, and 1 item with a check-all-that-apply list of types of self-help meeting involvement.

question.questionText: What is the number of tobacco retailers within 500 meter and 1 kilometer service areas around each participant address? (tobacco_retailer_density_residence)
What is the density? (Divide count by land area for each buffer. Land area is to be extracted from Census 2010 data) (tobacco_retailer_density_residence_calculated)
Using the ArcGIS Closest Facility tool, what is the calculated roadway distance (in meters) from each participant to the nearest tobacco retailer? (tobacco_retailer_proximity_residence)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The Global Appraisal of Individual Needs (GAIN) Self-Help Involvement Scale (SHIS) is a self-report instrument comprised of 1 item about days attending self-help meetings in the past 90 days, 16 items with yes/no questions about behaviors associated with engaging in self-help in the past 90 days, and 1 item with a check-all-that-apply list of types of self-help meeting involvement.

form.longName: PhenX PX750302 - Social Norms About Tobacco - Youth
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes one question from the Wave 1 Youth Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Survey, two questions from the Wave 1 Adult Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Survey, and one question from the "Changes in Peer and Parent Influence During Adolescence: Longitudinal Versus Cross-Sectional Perspectives on Smoking Initiation" publication (Chassin et al., 1986). Question one assesses household descriptive norms (i.e., others’ use of tobacco) by asking whether or not a respondent resides with one or more users of tobacco products. Question two assesses descriptive norms by asking the respondent how many of their friends smoke. Questions three and four assess injunctive norms (i.e., others’ approval of tobacco use) by asking the respondent about the opinions regarding tobacco use among close network members and, more generally, among most people.

question.questionText: Does anyone who lives with you now do any of the following? Choose all that apply (SocialNorms_Youth_Smoking_Household)

validValue.meaningText: Use smokeless tobacco, such as chewing tobacco, snuff, dip, or snus
validValue.description: Use smokeless tobacco, such as chewing tobacco, snuff, dip, or snus

validValue.meaningText: Smoke cigars, cigarillos, or filtered cigars
validValue.description: Smoke cigars, cigarillos, or filtered cigars

validValue.meaningText: No one who lives with me now uses any form of tobacco
validValue.description: No one who lives with me now uses any form of tobacco

question.questionText: How many of your five closest friends smoke cigarettes? (SocialNorms_Youth_Smoking_Friends_Acquaintances)
Thinking about the people who are important to you, how would you describe their opinion on using tobacco? (SocialNorms_Youth_Smoking_Opinion_LovedOnes)
How would you describe most people's opinion of using tobacco? (SocialNorms_Youth_Smoking_Opinion_GeneralPublic)

protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes one question from the Wave 1 Youth Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Survey, two questions from the Wave 1 Adult Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Survey, and one question from the "Changes in Peer and Parent Influence During Adolescence: Longitudinal Versus Cross-Sectional Perspectives on Smoking Initiation" publication (Chassin et al., 1986). Question one assesses household descriptive norms (i.e., others’ use of tobacco) by asking whether or not a respondent resides with one or more users of tobacco products. Question two assesses descriptive norms by asking the respondent how many of their friends smoke. Questions three and four assess injunctive norms (i.e., others’ approval of tobacco use) by asking the respondent about the opinions regarding tobacco use among close network members and, more generally, among most people.

form.longName: PhenX PX770101 - Selfreported General Health Status
form.preferredDefinition: The Global Appraisal of Individual Needs (GAIN) Self-Help Involvement Scale (SHIS) is a self-report instrument comprised of 1 item about days attending self-help meetings in the past 90 days, 16 items with yes/no questions about behaviors associated with engaging in self-help in the past 90 days, and 1 item with a check-all-that-apply list of types of self-help meeting involvement.

question.questionText: Would you say [fill: your/ALIAS's] health in general is excellent, very good, good, fair, or poor? (selfreported_health_status_assessment)
